data.title: List of All 30 NBA Teams in Alphabetical Order
data.meta_description: The NBA is home to 30 professional basketball teams, each with its own unique history and culture. Over the years, every one of these teams has had their own ups and downs, while also having some amazing and memorable players along the way.
data.text:
The NBA is home to 30 professional basketball teams, each with its own unique history and culture. Over the years, every one of these teams has had their own ups and downs, while also having some amazing and memorable players along the way.

Hereâs a comprehensive list of all NBA teams in alphabetical order, along with some interesting facts and notable players from each teamâs history.

All 30 NBA Teams in Alphabetical Order

Atlanta Hawks

The Atlanta Hawks were founded in 1946 and have called Atlanta home since 1968. Notable players from the teamâs history include Dominique Wilkins, Pete Maravich, and Bob Pettit. The Hawks have made it to the NBA Finals four times, but have yet to win a championship.

Boston Celtics

The Boston Celtics are one of the most storied franchises in NBA history, with 17 championships to their name. The team was founded in 1946 and has had many legendary players over the years, including Bill Russell, Larry Bird, and Paul Pierce.

Brooklyn Nets

The Brooklyn Nets were founded in 1967 as the New Jersey Americans and moved to Brooklyn in 2012. Notable players from the teamâs history include Julius Erving, Jason Kidd, and Vince Carter. The Nets have yet to win a championship.

Charlotte Hornets

The Charlotte Hornets were founded in 1988 and have had two separate stints in Charlotte, with a brief period in New Orleans in between. Notable players from the teamâs history include Larry Johnson, Alonzo Mourning, and Kemba Walker.

Chicago Bulls

The Chicago Bulls are another storied franchise with six championships to their name. The team was founded in 1966 and has had many legendary players over the years, including Michael Jordan, Scottie Pippen, and Derrick Rose.

Cleveland Cavaliers

The Cleveland Cavaliers were founded in 1970 and have had many notable players over the years, including LeBron James, Kyrie Irving, and Brad Daugherty. The Cavaliers won their first championship in 2016.

Dallas Mavericks

The Dallas Mavericks were founded in 1980 and won their first championship in 2011. Notable players from the teamâs history include Dirk Nowitzki, Steve Nash, and Jason Kidd.

Denver Nuggets

The Denver Nuggets were founded in 1967 and have had many notable players over the years, including Alex English, Carmelo Anthony, and Nikola Jokic. The Nuggets have yet to win a championship.

Detroit Pistons

The Detroit Pistons were founded in 1941 and have won three championships, most recently in 2004. Notable players from the teamâs history include Isiah Thomas, Chauncey Billups, and Ben Wallace.

Golden State Warriors

The Golden State Warriors were founded in 1946 and have won six championships, including three in the past five years. Notable players from the teamâs history include Wilt Chamberlain, Rick Barry, and Stephen Curry.

Houston Rockets

The Houston Rockets were founded in 1967 and have won two championships, both led by Hakeem Olajuwon. Notable players from the teamâs history include Tracy McGrady, Yao Ming, and James Harden.

Indiana Pacers

The Indiana Pacers were founded in 1967 and have had many notable players over the years, including Reggie Miller, Paul George, and Jermaine OâNeal. The Pacers have yet to win a championship.

Los Angeles Clippers

The Los Angeles Clippers were founded in 1970 and have had many notable players over the years, including Blake Griffin, Chris Paul, and Kawhi Leonard. The Clippers have yet to win a championship.

Los Angeles Lakers

The Los Angeles Lakers are one of the most storied franchises in NBA history, with 17 championships to their name. The team was founded in 1947 and has had many legendary players over the years, including Magic Johnson, Kobe Bryant, and Shaquille OâNeal.

Memphis Grizzlies

The Memphis Grizzlies were founded in 1995 and have had many notable players over the years, including Pau Gasol, Marc Gasol, and Mike Conley. The Grizzlies have yet to win a championship.

Miami Heat

The Miami Heat were founded in 1988 and have won three championships, all led by Dwyane Wade, LeBron James, and Chris Bosh. Other notable players from the teamâs history include Shaquille OâNeal and Alonzo Mourning.

Milwaukee Bucks

The Milwaukee Bucks were founded in 1968 and won their first championship in 1971 with Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. Notable players from the teamâs history include Oscar Robertson, Ray Allen, and Giannis Antetokounmpo.

Minnesota Timberwolves

The Minnesota Timberwolves were founded in 1989 and have had many notable players over the years, including Kevin Garnett, Kevin Love, and Karl-Anthony Towns. The Timberwolves have yet to win a championship.

New Orleans Pelicans

The New Orleans Pelicans were founded in 2002 as the New Orleans Hornets and changed their name to the Pelicans in 2013. Notable players from the teamâs history include Chris Paul, Anthony Davis, and Zion Williamson. The Pelicans have yet to win a championship.

New York Knicks

The New York Knicks are another storied franchise with two championships to their name. The team was founded in 1946 and has had many legendary players over the years, including Willis Reed, Patrick Ewing, and Carmelo Anthony.

Oklahoma City Thunder

The Oklahoma City Thunder were founded in 1967 as the Seattle SuperSonics and moved to Oklahoma City in 2008. Notable players from the teamâs history include Gary Payton, Shawn Kemp, and Kevin Durant. The Thunder have yet to win a championship since moving to Oklahoma City.

Orlando Magic

The Orlando Magic were founded in 1989 and have had many notable players over the years, including Shaquille OâNeal, Dwight Howard, and Penny Hardaway. The Magic have yet to win a championship.

Philadelphia 76ers

The Philadelphia 76ers were founded in 1946 and have won three championships, including one led by Allen Iverson in 2001. Other notable players from the teamâs history include Wilt Chamberlain, Julius Erving, and Charles Barkley.

Phoenix Suns

The Phoenix Suns were founded in 1968 and have had many notable players over the years, including Steve Nash, Charles Barkley, and Devin Booker. The Suns have yet to win a championship.

Portland Trail Blazers

The Portland Trail Blazers were founded in 1970 and won their first and only championship in 1977. Notable players from the teamâs history include Bill Walton, Clyde Drexler, and Damian Lillard.

Sacramento Kings

The Sacramento Kings were founded in 1945 and have had many notable players over the years, including Chris Webber, Peja Stojakovic, and DeMarcus Cousins. The Kings have yet to win a championship.

San Antonio Spurs

The San Antonio Spurs are another storied franchise with five championships to their name. The team was founded in 1967 and has had many legendary players over the years, including Tim Duncan, David Robinson, and Manu Ginobili.

Toronto Raptors

The Toronto Raptors were founded in 1995 and won their first championship in 2019 led by Kawhi Leonard. Other notable players from the teamâs history include Vince Carter, Chris Bosh, and Kyle Lowry.

Utah Jazz

The Utah Jazz were founded in 1974 and have had many notable players over the years, including Karl Malone, John Stockton, and Donovan Mitchell. The Jazz have yet to win a championship.

Washington Wizards

The Washington Wizards were founded in 1961 as the Chicago Packers and have gone through several name changes over the years. Notable players from the teamâs history include Wes Unseld, Elvin Hayes, and Gilbert Arenas. The Wizards have won one championship, in 1978 as the Washington Bullets.

Each NBA team has its own unique history and culture, with many legendary players and moments that have helped shape the league. Whether youâre a fan of a specific team or just enjoy watching the game, understanding the history and traditions of each team can add to your appreciation of the sport.

NBA Teams in Alphabetical Order with Championships

In addition to the list of professional basketball teams above, hereâs a table of all NBA team names in alphabetical order along with the number of championships they have won.
